4:00.race_name: Driving Range At High Gosforth Park Handicap Hurdle
4:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Horn Cape
runners.comment: Four 2m1f wins last term; ran well over that trip last month; not fully exposed over 2m4f
runners.spotlight: Made very good progress last season, collecting four 2m1f wins (three here) along the way; lightly raced this term but last month's third here (2m1f, good to soft) was perfectly respectable and he could plausibly have untapped potential over 2m4f.

quotes.race: Cazoo Search Drive Smile Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted to see Horn Cape follow up and I wasn't really in a hurry to run him again because he's a big horse, but my hand was forced with the handicappers reaction. He's seemed fresh and well this week and we thought we'd give it a go. - Ben Haslam, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's backward but that isn't surprising given his size. He's a nascent chaser and should come into his own this season, particularly when the ground is soft. He's still a novice over hurdles and we'll try to push on with him. 24-10-22

runners.name: Pay The Piper
runners.comment: Dual chase winner in the autumn and posted a sound effort over hurdles here this month
runners.spotlight: Useful chaser who won twice over 2m1f at Kelso (good/good to soft) in the autumn and posted a sound effort when second of four (albeit no threat to winner) off his lower hurdle mark here (2m1f, good to soft; refitted cheekpieces) this month; also suited by 2m4f; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Lihyan
runners.comment: Better than ever in the autumn but returned from break with disappointing run this month
runners.spotlight: Better than ever in the autumn, winning twice over 2m7f on good ground, but was tailed off over 2m4f this month after a break; probably needs to rebound with a career-best performance.

quotes.race: Sign Up To Our Newsletter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lihyan is not overly big but is well put together and came on leaps and bounds from the last day. He jumped far better today which was one of the goals we got right - Josh Halley, trainer

stable_tour.quote: The change to waiting tactics and a step up in trip have been the key to him. He's won three races over hurdles for us this season. If the ground is decent he could go for the conditional jockeys' race at Aintree, a 0-130 hurdle over 3m on October 27. He should get the strong gallop he needs there and he's certainly capable of winning a better pot than he's been playing for. Now we know he stays, the 3m races at Musselburgh will be ideal for him when the ground goes soft elsewhere. 16-10-24

runners.name: Coniston George
runners.comment: In career-best form in first-time visor at Carlisle this month, winning by 6l; up 7lb
runners.spotlight: Bounced back quickly from last month's poor performance and took form to whole new level at Carlisle (2m3f, good to soft; first-time visor) three weeks ago, keeping on strongly to win readily by 6l; went up 7lb for that but must be considered in current mood.

quotes.race: Southwaite Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Coniston George jumped and travelled well, which is all you can ask for. We put on a visor and it's probably just made him concentrate a little bit more and as he gets a little older maybe the extra half mile is much more to his liking now - Nicky Richards, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a grand horse. He ran a nice race at Haydock on his debut when just getting chinned on the line and then he cantered round to win at Ayr. I made the mistake of running him in the valuable bumper at Kelso as it came too soon for him. The only thing he's done wrong was my fault and I've got a good bit of faith in him. His jumping has gone well and we're about ready to rumble. He's interesting. 25-10-23

runners.name: Fingals Hill
runners.comment: Well beaten in valuable race this month but earlier form gives him a fighting chance
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in valuable Uttoxeter race this month but was in fairly good form beforehand, perhaps most notably when placed at Kelso (2m5f, good to soft) two starts ago; versatile regarding ground and still on a workable mark; considered.

quotes.race: Castletown Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I only have two horses so how could I be confident but Fingal's Hill is a good trier - we'll get to the bottom of him eventually but he keeps trying - Peter Atkinson, trainer.

runners.name: Stylish Recruit
runners.comment: Novice hurdle winner last spring but pulled up in two handicap chases since; risky
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo who made virtually all for narrow win in Hexham novice (2m, good) last June, but has been pulled up in two handicap chases since returning from a break in December; moves up in trip and reverts to hurdling today; not written off just yet but others look much less risky.

stable_tour.quote: He won a novice hurdle at Hexham nicely in the summer and then didn't back it up at Carlisle, but we later found a problem. It's been sorted now and he'll go back over fences, probably on a flat track. We're looking forward to him. 22-01-25

2:30.race_name: Live Sports At Fleet Street Newcastle Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
2:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Bishop Hill
runners.comment: Placed four times at Perth last spring/summer; big player if tuned up after break
runners.spotlight: Absent since below-par 2m4f run at Perth in September, but was placed in four consecutive maiden/novice hurdles over that C&D (good-soft) last spring/summer and will be in the thick of things if somewhere her best.

runners.name: Enas Choice
runners.comment: Quickly became very disappointing on the Flat in Ireland in 2023; back from long absence
runners.spotlight: Quickly became very disappointing on the Flat in Ireland in 2023 and this stable/hurdle debut comes after a 530-day absence.

runners.name: Generous Scorpion
runners.comment: Placed over 2m at Doncaster this month and ought to be suited by this return to 2m4f
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in Irish points in the autumn and has made the frame on both hurdling starts this year, most recently when third at Doncaster (2m, good) 17 days ago; has a bit to find on the figures but the move back up in trip ought to suit and she probably still has potential.

runners.name: Inta
runners.comment: Has not shown a great deal on her two hurdling starts this year (2m1f/2m4f)
runners.spotlight: Did not get competitive when seventh on last month's hurdling debut at Carlisle (2m1f, soft) and probably did not achieve a great deal when remote third of five at Ayr (2m4f, soft) 24 days ago; significant improvement required.

runners.name: Parisian Fashion
runners.comment: In the frame all three hurdling starts; can make a bold bid from the front
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who has made the frame on all three hurdling starts; faded into third (about 4l behind Wendywilldo) at Wetherby (2m3f, good to soft) on Boxing Day, but that was after running a big race from the front and she can make another bold bid.

stable_tour.quote: She's out of Legacy Gold, who won the Listed mares' bumper at the Grand National meeting for Stuart Crawford and was a good hurdler, and she jumped very well when winning a point-to-point at Bartlemy by ten lengths. She's been bought by Michael Scholey and will go straight over hurdles - the £50,000 mares' novice handicap at Kelso in the spring could be a target. 16-10-24

runners.name: Wendywilldo
runners.comment: Went close at Wetherby on Boxing Day and had excuses when disappointing favourite since
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who bettered her low-key hurdling debut when keeping on well to go close at Wetherby (2m3f, good to soft) on Boxing Day and had a valid excuse when a disappointing favourite on her next outing (bled from the nose); needs to prove herself on good ground but can play a leading role if back on song.

3:00.race_name: Sunday Lunch At The Border Minstrel Novices' Handicap Chase
3:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Community Rebel
runners.comment: Kept on well for second over C&D on this month's chasing debut; cheekpieces added today
runners.spotlight: Returned from long absence with two underwhelming hurdle runs this year, but kept on well for creditable second over C&D (good to soft) when switched to fences 16 days ago; will be a tough nut to crack if the first-time cheekpieces have any positive effect.

runners.name: Giveupyerauldsins
runners.comment: Won novice hurdle here in December but soundly beaten in two subsequent handicap hurdles
runners.spotlight: Caused 18-1 surprise in novice hurdle here (2m6f, good) here in December, but has been soundly beaten in two 3m handicaps this year (wore headgear for both) and has quite a bit to prove on this chasing debut.

runners.name: Shesupincourt
runners.comment: Wide-margin winner last month; bumped into gambled-on improver when second ten days ago
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who drew 14l clear to open chasing account at Leicester (2m4f, heavy) last month; no match for gambled-on  improver when second at Ffos Las (2m3f, good) ten days ago, but still ran well and today's move back up in trip will suit.

quotes.race: Belvoir Mares' Handicap Chase (Queen Boudicca Mares' Chase Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Shesupincourt has been knocking on the door and was always going to win over fences, it's just been a matter of when. She loves testing ground so the conditions were ideal for her - she likes it borderline unraceable. Ryan Potter, trainer.

quotes.race: Yorton's "Postponed" Conditional Jockeys' Training Series Mares' Handicap Hurdle (RE Excellence)
quotes.quote: Shesupincourt was unlucky to unseat (chase debut) last time. She's a very nice mare to ride and is very game - James Turner, jockey.

runners.name: Mobile Mamma
runners.comment: Pulled up on handicap hurdle debut but could still have a good future over fences
runners.spotlight: Pulled up when upped to 3m for handicap hurdle debut six weeks ago, but remains very unexposed under rules and her emphatic Irish point win last spring bodes well for her chasing prospects.

runners.name: Deep Strato

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Encouraging fourth on handicap hurdle debut; open to significant improvement over fences
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer who was an encouraging fourth on handicap hurdle debut at Carlisle (2m3f, soft) in December, before running as though something was amiss last month; needs to prove himself on good ground, but is open to significant improvement over this new trip on chasing debut.

runners.name: Thatsy
runners.owner: Mrs B Butterworth & Mrs Jackie Holliday

prev_owners.owner: K Haughey & Laura Haughey & Kieran T Byrne

runners.comment: Regressive 11yo with 0-22 record over fences; recent wind op the last roll of the dice
runners.spotlight: Regressive 11yo who useful in his prime, but was beaten about 18l when fourth at Wetherby (3m, soft) last month and is now 0-22 over fences; ought to handle the faster ground here but recent wind op (his third) could be the last roll of the dice.

quotes.race: www.navanracecourse.ie Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a grand horse and he's been threatening to that for a while. It was nice to get his head in front, and the tongue tie might have helped - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: I don't know what his trip is. I run him over two miles and it looks like he wants two and a half, then we run him over two and a half and it looks like he needs two. He got tired at Galway but he should come on from it. We'll try and win our beginners' chase and take things from there. 09-11-20

runners.name: Toombridge
runners.breeder: Little Lodge Farm & Lucky Bin Racing
runners.comment: Seemingly aided by cheekpieces when twice running well in recent weeks
runners.spotlight: 0-17 under all codes but gave very good account before weakening into fourth of 15 at Carlisle (3m, soft; first-time cheekpieces) last month and was again running well before penultimate-fence fall here (2m4f, good) four weeks ago; contender if the new headgear continues to have a positive effect.

4:30.race_name: Golf Memberships At High Gosforth Park Handicap Chase
4:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Fia Fuinidh
runners.comment: Came second twice in the autumn but has lost his way a bit since
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with two good seconds in the autumn (2m/2m1f), but has lost his way a bit since and is unraced on ground quicker than good to soft (withdrawn from a recent engagement with good deemed unsuitable).

runners.name: Goodtimes Badtimes
runners.comment: Placed in three good-ground chases last year but has looked out of sorts lately
runners.spotlight: Placed in three good-ground chases last year, most notably when close second at Sedgefield (2m5f) in October, but has looked out of sorts lately; leap of faith to support him.

quotes.race: Go North Brindisi Breeze Series Final (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Goodtimes Badtimes has just gone from strength to strength and will be a great prospect for going over fences. We got beaten by a southern raider in this race last year, so it's good to get the win now - Sandy Thomson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's ready to run again. He's a bit tricky to ride and probably got in front a bit soon at Sedgefield last time. He came back with a bit of an injury but that's all cleared up now. He won a Go North Final a few seasons back and then got a bit of a leg problem. He should give his owners some more fun. 22-01-25

runners.name: Empty Nest
runners.owner: M Blades, S Morrell, K Hathaway
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with a win and has run well in defeat on both outings this year (once over C&D)
runners.spotlight: Won comfortably in first-time tongue-tie at Wetherby (2m3f, good to soft) on Boxing Day and ran well in defeat on both subsequent outings (once over C&D); not sure to be favoured by today's faster ground but still features prominently in calculations.

quotes.race: William Hill Offers Top Price Guarantees Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We always thought Empty Nest was quite a decent horse and he never quite put it together on the track. He's been frustrating and we thought about retirement but we took him to Malton and he worked really well. I'm not sure what's made the difference but something has definitely worked - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.name: Soldier Dan
runners.comment: Beaten about 28l on last month's chase/handicap debut (3m) but remains very unexposed
runners.spotlight: Made low-key start to rules career in 2m hurdles during the winter and was beaten about 28l when fifth on last month's chase/handicap debut at Market Rasen (3m, good to soft); however, he remains very unexposed and might benefit from today's drop back in trip; worth a second look.

runners.name: Beat The Edge
runners.comment: Largely consistent for new stable since the autumn and probably still on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent for new stable since the autumn and collected a small-field win at Catterick (2m3f, soft) on New Year's Day; will be fine on today's faster ground and is probably still on a workable mark; respected.

runners.name: Kicksaftersix
runners.comment: Placed in four early-season chases but absent since below-par run in November
runners.spotlight: Runner-up three consecutive times off slightly higher marks last summer/autumn (1m7f-2m5f, good-soft), but was slightly below form when last seen in November and does not have compelling record fresh.

runners.name: Cave Hill
runners.comment: Course winner over hurdles in December but dropped out rather tamely on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles in 16-runner handicap here (2m4f, good) in December and has been placed at Ayr (2m4f, soft) since, but dropped out of contention very tamely when favourite for chasing debut over C&D (good) four weeks ago; now has a point to prove.

3:30.race_name: Mini Golf At High Gosforth Park Novices' Handicap Hurdle
3:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Kilmore Rock
runners.comment: Has not progressed since last summer's win but ran well in recent 2m7f Hexham handicap
runners.spotlight: Yet to progress from last summer's winning hurdle debut at Hexham (2m4f, good), but ran well when fourth of 15 in 2m7f handicap there (good to soft) this month and can play a big role here if aided by new cheekpieces.

runners.name: Adveram
runners.comment: Not seen since disappointing run in January but earlier form gives him strong claims
runners.spotlight: Scored at Ayr (2m3f, good to soft) on seasonal debut in October and made the frame over 3m on his next three outings (good to soft-soft); not seen since disappointing run in January and not sure to be ideally suited by today's faster ground, but has a good chance if back on song.

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Best Odds Daily Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's Adveram's first win. He's a bit stronger this season and has improved - Ian Duncan, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Killybegs Jet Lady
runners.comment: Fair fourth when upped to 2m7f for last month's handicap debut; probably needed recent run
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles but kept on for respectable fourth when upped to 2m7f for last spring's handicap debut at Uttoxeter (good to soft) and probably needed her reappearance run here (2m4f) four weeks ago; may still have a bigger performance in her.

runners.name: So Ladylike
runners.comment: Hexham winner last spring; didn't fire on latest outing but has possibilities
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish veteran mare who came good for Nick Alexander at second attempt, under Natasha Cookson at Hexham (2m7f, soft) last spring; needs to leave last month's poor effort behind but her reappearance run in January was very encouraging and she's effectively only 1lb above her winning mark.

runners.name: Teddy Mac
runners.comment: Ran very poorly last time and is now 0-9 over hurdles; yard's other one appeals much more
runners.spotlight: Competitive (albeit without being placed) off lowly marks since switched to handicaps this season and ought to be suited by today's trip-and-ground combination, but his latest run was very disappointing; 3lb wrong and sports first-time cheekpieces; stable's other runner appeals much more.

runners.name: Angus De Bull
runners.comment: Unplaced all eight hurdling starts and competes from 15lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all eight hurdling starts and reverts to this discipline after a down-the-field finish off his basement Flat mark last month; tries this new trip from 15lb out of the weights and not the most obvious answer.

5:00.race_name: Grand National At Fleet Street Newcastle Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
5:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Willie Shake Hands
runners.comment: Ran big race in defeat over C&D last month despite racing too freely; major player
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles but ran big race in defeat over C&D (good to soft) last month, despite racing too freely; ought to be fine on today's faster ground; likely contender.

runners.name: Jumping Jupiter
runners.comment: Good Hexham winner last spring but absent since two disappointing runs in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Started off for Mark Walford with two good runs last spring, the latter a win at Hexham (2m, good), but disappointed on his two outings in the autumn and returns from latest break with a point to prove.

runners.name: Socks Off
runners.comment: Ran fairly well in a recent hunter chase and is well handicapped on older hurdling form
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in two handicaps chases in the autumn (2m/2m3f; visored) and rebounded from disappointing run with respectable third in recent hunter chase (2m5f; wore cheekpieces); well handicapped on older hurdling form; no surprise if he features.

stable_tour.quote: He won for us at Sedgefield around this time last year and was then a little bit unfortunate on a couple of occasions. He'll be competitive off his mark and the plan is to mix between hurdles and fences over the summer. 24-01-24

runners.name: Wild Nephin
runners.owner: K P Marsh Plastering & Interiors Ltd
runners.comment: Bumped into revitalised opponent when second at Huntingdon recently; only 1lb higher
runners.spotlight: Has mixed record over hurdles since Irish point win in October, but was unlucky to bump into rejuvenated opponent when second at Huntingdon (2m, good, first-time tongue-tie) this month and is only 1lb higher here.

runners.name: The Dipper
runners.comment: Showed no significant promise in his four qualifying races but may improve in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Showed no significant promise in his four qualifying races (2m-2m1f) but remains very unexposed and is worth a glance in the betting before today's handicap debut.

runners.name: Mix De Gris
runners.breeder: Daniel Cherdo, Claudie Cherdo & Haras De
runners.comment: Slightly disappointing last time but has claims if judged on earlier C&D fourth
runners.spotlight: Seems to have learned to settle better on recent outings and kept on well for close fourth (just behind Willie Shake Hands) over C&D (good to soft) last month; slightly disappointing at Ayr since but still considered.

runners.name: Morans Law
runners.comment: Faded into fifth on last month's handicap debut (2m4f); may fare better now back at 2m
runners.spotlight: Faded into fifth on last month's handicap debut at Sedgefield (2m4f, good to soft), but that run was arguably a bit better than his eventual 15l defeat might suggest and he may benefit from this drop back in trip.

runners.name: Belle Na Bann

prev_owners.owner: Ms D Morley, S Dobson & Partner

runners.comment: Four-time hurdle winner; on a good mark now but not firing on all cylinders lately
runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdle winner (once over C&D) who is versatile regarding ground; on a good mark now (even from 2lb out of the weights) but has not been firing on all cylinders in recent months.

runners.name: Likleman
runners.comment: Has shown some hurdling ability but his tendency to pull hard is a serious concern
runners.spotlight: Won off basement mark on the Flat for Simon West in September and has shown some hurdling ability this year, but his tendency to pull hard is a serious worry before this stable/handicap debut; 2lb wrong.

6:30.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap

runners.name: Wadacre Gomez
runners.comment: Struggled this winter but several reasons to expect a better showing down in class today
runners.spotlight: Had a productive 11 months from August 2023, winning six times (including C&D); has struggled this winter and the handicapper has been slow to react but his latest 2lb drop, in a race where he didn't run as badly as the distance beaten suggests, makes him eligible for this Class 4 event; cheekpieces now tried and Billy Loughnane, who is 3-5 (one void race) on him, returns to the saddle; better expected.

quotes.race: Leading Environmental Solutions Handicap
quotes.quote: Wadacre Gomez is very straightforward and I'm a passenger really on him. The hardest part is getting him out of the gates and from then on, he pretty much does it himself, sets his own fractions. The Johnston horses have that tough trait in them and they keep going when they need too - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Mr Baloo
runners.comment: Thriving this year; new trip worth exploring and he's feared despite his 5lb penalty
runners.spotlight: On the up this year and he comes here seeking his fourth win from his last five starts; up in distance this time but he was strong at the finish over 8.6f last week and he's respected despite a 5lb penalty.

runners.name: Silent Age
runners.comment: Needs to step up on two runs for new stable in 2025; up in trip; yard also runs Shahbaz
runners.spotlight: Big prices and no better than midfield in two runs for new yard this year; edging down the weights and he wasn't beaten far last time; stable also run Shahbaz.

runners.name: Lordsbridge Blu
runners.comment: Improving with experience and still has potential; drawn widest back from a break
runners.spotlight: Novice win came over C&D last September; ended 2024 with three solid handicap runs over further; not fully exposed but he's drawn widest back from 130 days off.

runners.name: Sari Dubai
runners.comment: Two wins in Dubai for Doug Watson; low-key stable debut at Chelmsford 18 days ago
runners.spotlight: Two wins in Dubai for Doug Watson; low-key stable debut at Chelmsford this month (1m2f) and a 3lb drop may not be sufficient.

runners.name: Perfectly Timed
runners.comment: 2 wins in 2024, including easily tried in blinkers when last seen; up 6lb in a better race
runners.spotlight: 1m maiden win at Kempton 13 months ago; ended 2024 with an easy win at Newcastle in September (1m2f; blinkered first time); 6lb rise in a stronger race could find him out on his return.

runners.name: Son Of Man
runners.comment: Market mover and fared much better when 3rd of ten over C&D this month; contender
runners.spotlight: Market springer and ran a much better race when third of ten over C&D three weeks ago; one to take seriously off an unchanged mark.

runners.name: Eagle Day
runners.comment: Two C&D wins in Dec; gone off the boil more recently but revival not out of the question
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins in December; not in quite the same form more recently but he's not handicapped out of things if returning to his best.

runners.name: Charlies Choice
runners.comment: Three wins this winter, one over C&D; others appeal as being better treated
runners.spotlight: Three wins this winter, one of them over C&D; respectable efforts the last twice but others appeal as being better treated.

quotes.race: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (Gbbplus Race)
quotes.quote: Charlie's Choice is ultra consistent and seems to like it here too. There wasn't much pace and we were able just to roll forward and get a position. He's a very willing partner and battled back well - Kieran Shoemark, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Dayzee
runners.comment: Looks on the downgrade and although her mark continues to drop, she's not a solid option
runners.spotlight: Looks on the downgrade and although her mark continues to drop, she's not a solid option.

quotes.race: Floodlit Fridays At Dundalk Fillies' Maiden
quotes.quote: Dayzee has always showed us plenty at home. Jack just let her get into a rhythm and he said she was still a bit green. She will go a bit further - Mark Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Oslo
runners.comment: Last three Flat runs, all at Kempton over further, have been okay; more needed here though
runners.spotlight: Respectable efforts at Kempton on his last three Flat runs without suggesting he was the answer now dropping back in distance.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a little unlucky not to win this year with three seconds, all at Lingfield. Last week he was a little disappointing but they crawled round and he needs a good pace, so when they quickened he was caught out. He will have a break now before coming back on the turf. I think he can win on the grass in fact he could be a better horse than on the all-weather. He seems versatile regarding trip, but I feel 1m4f in a true run race would be ideal for him, as when it is run slowly he gets a bit keen and is hard to settle. 29-03-21

runners.name: Shahbaz
runners.comment: Second to thriving rival over C&D this month; up 2lb but headgear returns
runners.spotlight: Found his level for new yard and this month's C&D second behind a thriving rival was encouraging; 2lb higher today but could benefit from the return of cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed as the season went on last year culminating with victory over 1m1f in a Newmarket nursery off a mark of 82. This season he has had two runs, not troubling the judge on either occasion, and he was a bit disappointing last time out at Ascot over 1m2f, where they went no gallop which did not suit him. I am still not convinced he gets 1m2f as if you watch a replay of that race he is weakening as they approach the line. I did put him in the London Gold Cup last Saturday, but it was too dry to run him. I will give him another try over 1m2f and see, but I would not be surprised if we drop him back to a milen. The key to him is the race must be run at proper pace. 28-05-23

8:00.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.name: King Of The Dance

prev_owners.owner: HP Racing King Of The Dance

runners.comment: Won C&D handicap on Thursday and is an obvious contender under his penalty today
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to exploit favourable handicap mark over C&D on Thursday and, despite his 5lb penalty, is a very obvious contender in this classified race.

stable_tour.quote: He ran once last year when an encouraging third over 6f at Windsor. He had a few issues after that, hence why he didn't run again until last month when finishing in mid-division at Lingfield. He was ring rusty but has come on in leaps and bounds since and the plan will be for another novice to get a handicap mark - he could be a dark horse for later in the season. 03-08-22

runners.name: Ajrad
runners.comment: Respectable fourth in recent 7f handicap; each-way claims if stamina holds out today
runners.spotlight: Two-time winner since joining current yard last summer, more recently in 7f handicap here in January; just a respectable fourth over that trip this month but has each-way claims if stamina holds out on first venture beyond 1m.

stable_tour.quote: He's only just joined us- he's a horse who appeared to be hard to win with and the owners sent him to us for a change of scenery. We've only had him a few weeks and so it'll be interesting how we'll get on with him. He's a 7f-1m horse. 11-07-24

runners.name: Bay Of Naples

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Placed in 1m3f handicap last month but safely held since; may find 8.6f too sharp today
runners.spotlight: Gave good account when placed in 1m3f Southwell handicap last month but was below that form after racing too freely over 1m4f there recently and it's questionable whether this drop back to 8.6f will suit.

quotes.race: It's National Racehorse Week Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Bay Of Naples was suited by the way the race was run today. They got racing a long way out before coming back to him and he stayed on well ? he gets a bit further. Connor (Planas) hasn't panicked and gave him a lovely ride - Michael Herrington, trainer.

runners.name: Big Narstie
runners.breeder: S A Stilvi Compania Financiera Et Al
runners.comment: Placed three times in this grade this year, most recently at Lingfield (1m2f) a week ago
runners.spotlight: Placed twice in this grade on Tapeta for Michael Appleby this year (7f/1m) and went close at Lingfield (1m2f) a week ago, his second start for Tony Carroll; each-way claims at least.

quotes.race: Bombardier "March To Your Own Drum" Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Big Narstie has a great attitude and is still learning and did that nicely. Thanks to Phil Cunningham for keeping me on him after his run in France - Hayley Turner, jockey.

runners.name: Bitacora
runners.comment: Ex-Irish maiden who was soundly beaten in 7f handicaps on first two stable starts
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who was soundly beaten in 7f handicaps on first two starts for Daragh Bourke; booking of Sean Levey makes her worth a glance in the betting but others in the line-up have much less to prove.

runners.name: Capallcliste
runners.comment: Second stable run was better than yard debut but another step forward is needed
runners.spotlight: 22-race maiden; bettered disappointing stable debut when fifth of ten over 7f in this grade three weeks ago and will be fine over this longer trip but needs to take another step forward today.

runners.name: Glencalvie
runners.comment: Yet to hit top gear for current stable; considered only if lively in the betting
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly in 1m Chelmsford handicap two outings ago and benefits from a drop in grade today but is yet to hit top gear after five starts for her new stable; considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.name: Hawajes
runners.breeder: Ghs Bloodstock Ltd & Tally Ho Stud
runners.comment: 7f winner in January but not in same form again since, and this trip may just stretch him
runners.spotlight: Won in this grade over 7f at Southwell in January but has not been in the same form again since and today's move back up in trip may not be ideal.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Classified Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: Hawajes is very lazy. He's always slowly away and today he was last out and I was really having to keep him with them. It set up nicely in the end because they've gone a good clip in front and he's done it well - Jack Doughty, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He's been second in his last two starts following a 114-day break, running well both times. He has been entered at Brighton on Wednesday in the classified stakes and on Thursday too. It's possible he might run on both days and we'll see. He's coming into form, he's a nice little horse and has done nothing wrong. He'd be my dark horse. 07-08-24

runners.name: Pending Appeal
runners.owner: Dr M Voikhansky & Mrs S Voikhanskaya
runners.comment: Had poor campaign for new stable last year; absent since September
runners.spotlight: Fair 6f/7f performer for Charles Hills in 2022/2023 but had very disappointing campaign for new stable last year; absent since September and needs to prove some ability remains.

quotes.race: Fairfax Saddles Grassroots Series Final Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I spent most of the middle part of the race taking a pull on Pending Appeal and trying to fill her up. She's a quick filly and I maybe went 50 yards too soon, but she just did enough to hold on. Six furlongs is her limit at this stage and the nice ground suited her well - David Egan, jockey.

runners.name: Possible Ambition
runners.comment: Back from layoff with two down-the-field runs this month; difficult to enthuse over
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in 9.4f handicap here on stable debut 13 months ago but well down the field all four starts since, the last twice this month; very difficult to enthuse over at present.

quotes.race: Leicester Racecourse Ideal Christmas Party Venue Selling Stakes
quotes.quote: I thought I was beat. The second horse completely stopped and Possible Ambition got there just inside the furlong and I didn't want to take the momentum back off him because he was waiting on the other horse a little. He won in the end, which is all that matters. He acts on this ground, which is a big help, and it's quite attritional out there -Jason Hart, jockey.

runners.name: Tilsworth Max
runners.comment: Ran quite well in Chelmsford handicap this month but overall profiles remains unappealing
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden (including one bumper run); outran 80-1 odds when very respectable sixth in 1m Chelmsford handicap this month but overall profiles remains unappealing.

runners.name: Werenotreallyhere
runners.comment: Very respectable fifth at Lingfield (1m2f) last week; probably better suited by this C&D
runners.spotlight: No longer the force of old but appreciated drop to this grade and took step back in the right direction when fifth of 12 at Lingfield (1m2f) a week ago; probably better suited by this C&D; might be the answer.

5:30.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Hinitsa Bay
runners.comment: Modest form in two turf runs in the summer of 2023; best watched after his absence
runners.spotlight: Modest form in two turf runs in the summer of 2023; has caused problems at the start and unlikely to be of serious interest until handicapping.

runners.name: I Was Thinking
runners.comment: Down the field in two runs here (7f and 6f) this month; minor handicaps beckon
runners.spotlight: Down the field in two runs here (7f and 6f) this month; minor handicaps beckon.

runners.name: Art Of Fox
runners.comment: Failed to build on debut promise (7f) when dropped to 5f last week; can do better
runners.spotlight: Went off too fast on his debut here three weeks ago (7f); failed to improve dropped to 5f last week; should do better at some point and this might be his trip.

runners.name: Double Rush
runners.comment: Not at his best on heavy ground when last seen but first two runs bring him right into it
runners.spotlight: Three runs in 6f turf novices last year, showing fair form on the first two occasions before a lesser run on heavy when last seen in October; one to consider on his seasonal/AW debut.

runners.name: Nordic Games
runners.comment: Signs of ability here on this month's C&D debut but bred for longer trips
runners.spotlight: This month's C&D debut wasn't without hope and his pedigree offers hope of much better at some stage; that's likely to be over longer trips than this though.

runners.name: Wild Embers
runners.comment: Promise amidst inexperience on Dundalk debut (5f) in January; e-w shout on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Green off the bridle but still shaped with some promise when third of 12 at Dundalk in January (5f); wouldn't need much more to play a part on his stable debut.

runners.name: French Sand
runners.comment: Promising 2nd over C&D 16 days ago; should be more clued up today and she's a contender
runners.spotlight: Ended up quite wide in the closing stages of her C&D debut 16 days ago but she was keeping on well for second and should have learned from the experience; one to consider.

runners.name: Kinswoman
runners.comment: Finished 1l behind French Sand on debut here 16 days ago (11-8 fav); capable of better
runners.spotlight: Finished 1l behind French Sand on her debut 16 days ago, a race in which she was sent off the 11-8 favourite; can do better with the run behind her and she's high on the list.

6:00.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.name: Cosmos Raj
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and on a dangerous mark; interesting on the back of a good recent 3rd
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D last winter and now 5lb lower than for the second of them; running himself back into form this winter, most recently finishing third of eight here 19 days ago; one to take seriously.

runners.name: Star Pupil
runners.comment: Prominent racer; comes here in good form and should make another bold bid
runners.spotlight: Red-hot favourite when winning a 7f handicap at Chelmsford in good style in January; runner-up in two of his three runs since; this prominent racer should remain competitive.

runners.name: Ciotog
runners.comment: C&D win in January but more recent efforts have been less convincing; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win a C&D handicap in January; more recent efforts less convincing though and others appeal more.

runners.name: Pursuit Of Truth
runners.comment: Pick of five runs for O Burrows when 2nd of 13 at Kempton (1m) in October; betting useful
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in five runs for Owen Burrows, notably when second of 13 in a 1m handicap at Kempton last October; sold for 17,000gns later that month; market instructive on stable debut.

runners.name: Harlem Nights
runners.owner: R Teatum And Steel A Win
runners.comment: Third over C&D in January; flopped last time but had a wind op since; dangerous mark
runners.spotlight: Won twice in 2023 when trained by James Horton; 0-9 for current stable but he was a good third over C&D in January (well backed) and he's had a wind op since flopping at Newcastle eight weeks ago; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Harlem Nights is going the right way. The only time he hasn't been in the frame this year was when the ground was very fast at York and he didn't enjoy it. He's thriving on his racing and he's a lovely, straightforward horse. I put him in at Newmarket on Friday this morning and we'll see how he is and what the handicapper does - James Horton, trainer.

runners.name: Tea Sea
runners.comment: Tapeta hat-trick this winter; had excuses at Kempton last time; still feasibly treated
runners.spotlight: Reeled off a Tapeta hat-trick (7f twice and 1m) around the turn of the year; beaten off this mark twice since his latest win but he saw no daylight until it was too late at Kempton last time; wouldn't want a crawl but still feasibly treated.

runners.name: Prince Ali
runners.comment: Three course wins since September; met trouble in running last time; can go well again
runners.spotlight: Three course wins since September, the latest a game win over 9.5f three weeks ago; only fourth nine days ago but shaped as though still in good form (met trouble).

quotes.race: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Acca Club Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Prince Ali looks keen sometimes but he's just got a big stride and when they go steady you have to keep breaking his stride then he becomes keen. He doesn't do a lot when he gets there and I think this is his trip - Rab Havlin, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

7:30.race_name: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap

runners.name: Easter Icon
runners.comment: C&D win last winter; awarded a 2m handicap here last month; more needed up 3lb
runners.spotlight: C&D win last winter; back to winning ways when awarded a 2m handicap here eight weeks ago (hampered on a couple of occasions by the first past the post); 3lb rise asks a stiffer question but still commands respect.

runners.name: Alex The Great
runners.comment: Two 2m wins this year but below his best at Newcastle last week; others better treated
runners.spotlight: Two wins (2m) since a wind op in December, the latest by a wide margin at Newcastle 24 days ago; that was a poor race, however, and he's since finished well held back there last week; others perhaps better treated.

runners.name: Daaris
runners.comment: Two C&D wins this winter, the latest a cosy one nine days ago; contender up 3lb
runners.spotlight: This winter's two wins have both come over C&D, the latest a comfortable 2l success nine days ago (for today's rider); 3lb higher mark to deal with but still more appealing than many.

runners.name: Cloudside Rock
runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo; stepping up to 1m6f can help and he's an interesting contender
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo; close fourth in a 1m4f handicap here two weeks ago; dropped 1lb for his troubles and could take a step forward now stepped up to 1m6f for the first time.

runners.name: Khangai
runners.comment: Four 1m4f wins this winter; below par latest but type to bounce back quickly
runners.spotlight: As with so many from his yard he has enjoyed a good winter, winning four 1m4f handicaps; stays this longer trip and likely to bounce back quickly from a lesser run at Southwell 16 days ago with Hector Crouch back on board.

runners.name: Moon Over The Sea
runners.comment: Comes here in good order but vulnerable to progressive sorts; now tries 1m6f for 1st time
runners.spotlight: 1m4f win here in December and has finished second on his last three starts, chasing home a handicap blot at Southwell 16 days ago; likely to remain vulnerable to anything progressive; first run over 1m6f.

runners.name: Man Of Riddles
runners.comment: Down in the weights but doesn't look in the form required to take advantage
runners.spotlight: 7lb lower than for his 2m Chelmsford win last January but he hasn't been at his best in three runs this year (after 285 days off); down in weights but with plenty to prove.

runners.name: Gold Souk

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: In good form when last seen but that was 700 days ago; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Had a wind operation prior to landing a gamble at Bath in April 2023 (11.5f, soft); two solid efforts followed that spring but he's been absent for 700 days and would need to be notably strong in the market to warrant an interest on his return.

quotes.race: Novibet Handicap
quotes.quote: Gold Souk had been missing the break but the cheekpieces have helped today and he was just dossing a bit when he hit the front - Joshua Bryan, jockey.

4:55.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Amateur Jockeys' Handicap

runners.name: Kurimu
runners.comment: Of interest on last year's best and she travelled kindly on recent stable debut; contender
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on her form for Chris Dwyer last season and she travelled well for a long way on her stable debut/reappearance at Chelmsford 18 days ago (7f; just over 1l behind The Cola Brasil); can get it wrong at the start but there should be a pace to aim at and she's one to consider.

runners.name: Alafdhal
runners.comment: Good form claims and top amateur booked; feared despite a double-figure stall
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner, most recently over 5f here in January, and he was a good second over C&D two weeks ago; not in the same form at Chelmsford on Thursday and he has a wide stall to overcome today but this mark is in range and he has the assistance of a top amateur.

quotes.race: Support The Injured Jockeys Fund Handicap
quotes.quote: They went hard up front which helped Alafdhal and the race fell apart. That's four from four around here now and he's done well to come through as he has had his health issues and has also had me running him over the wrong trip - Phil McEntee, trainer.

runners.name: So Grateful
runners.owner: The Mick & David Easterby Racing Group
runners.comment: Ended losing run at Newcastle 19 days ago (5f); 3lb rise not insurmountable; contender
runners.spotlight: Finally capitalised on his drop in the weights when narrowly landing a 5f handicap at Newcastle 19 days ago; return to 6f no bother and he's still feasibly weighted up 3lb.

quotes.race: Napoleons Casino Bradford Handicap
quotes.quote: Good ride wasn't it? It's alright having the idea but you've got to follow it through and Shane (Gray) didn't go too fast. When you go out on a limb it's easy to get the fractions wrong and he didn't do that. I think the only reason So Grateful won is because of the tactics we took on, so the handicapper should drop us for that! - David Easterby, joint-trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Drafted
runners.comment: 7f win off this mark in November for D Brooke; needs to bounce back from a poor run latest
runners.spotlight: 7f win at Newcastle for Danny Brooke in November off this mark; good third on his stable debut at Newcastle in January (1m) but failed to back it up last time; drop to 6f not sure to suit.

runners.name: The Cola Brasil
runners.comment: Solid start for new yard 18 days ago (7f); should get a pace to aim at; respected
runners.spotlight: Three wins in Ireland, the latest in a 7f handicap at Dundalk last October; satisfactory start for his new yard when fourth at Chelmsford 18 days ago (7f); that was his rider's first ride under rules and he looked polished for one who can claim 7lb at this level; he'll need a good pace back at 6f but that would appear likely.

quotes.race: Come Racing To Fairyhouse Next Sunday Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: The Cola Brasil is a big gangly horse that takes a bit of organising. He stayed at it well and won it well. He's in again on Sunday and I might run him - Mick Browne, trainer.

runners.name: Nevernay
runners.comment: 0-13 but has shown promise over 7f here this winter; inexperienced amateur booked
runners.spotlight: 0-13 but he's shown the odd bit of promise here over 7f this winter; inexperienced rider on board and his maiden status looks set to remain intact.

runners.name: Under Curfew
runners.comment: Nine-time winner, including C&D, but the widest stall presents complications today
runners.spotlight: Gained his ninth career win when readily accounting for eight rivals in a 0-55 over C&D last month; not so good twice since and he has the widest stall to negotiate this afternoon.

quotes.race: Best Free Tips At valuerater.co.uk Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Under Curfew travelled beautifully. I was told to follow our other horse [Bezzas Lad] but he went off too quick. We slotted in and he couldn't try any more for me ? I couldn't stop screaming from two out - Mollie Phillips, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Bath in May and then again at Salisbury last month.  He was second at Bath last Friday night - it looked an easy opportunity for him with just three runners, but they're never easy and 5f on very fast ground probably just caught him out - he's more a 6f horse really. The winner of the race is possibly all right. He'll run in the Bullet at Brighton on Friday. All ground comes alike to him and he's in good form. 07-08-24

runners.name: Monsieur Fantaisie

prev_owners.owner: Phil Hart And The Cross Racing Club

runners.comment: This winter's peak efforts have come over 7f; not at his best the last twice; others safer
runners.spotlight: This winter's best form, including his Southwell win in January, has come over 7f; his form has dipped on his last two starts and he's perhaps vulnerable off this mark.

runners.name: Global Effort
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate II
runners.comment: Three course wins since June; fair effort over 5f here two weeks ago; yard run two
runners.spotlight: Three course wins in the last nine months and not beaten far, despite a wide trip, in a 5f classified event two weeks ago; has the ability to feature at this level but stable may have stronger claims with Alafdhal.

runners.name: Doves Of Peace
runners.comment: C&D win for Michael Bell last year; well beaten in two runs for current stable this year
runners.spotlight: C&D winner for Michael Bell last season; unplaced in two runs for new yard this year and others look more persuasive.

runners.name: Banana

prev_owners.owner: Scott Dixon Racing , M Mahony , L Bond

runners.comment: 45-race maiden but she has been running well at a low level this year; e-w shout again
runners.spotlight: Another placed effort when second in classified event over C&D on Thursday but that took her record to 0-45; more minor money perhaps her best hope.

runners.name: French Haven
runners.comment: Showed some promise last term; open to improvement now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise with her fifth-place finishes last term and was perhaps unsuited by heavy ground on final outing; open to improvement now handicapping.

runners.name: Yes Honey
runners.comment: Handicap debutante whose penultimate effort gives cause for optimism
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; not entirely solid on her maiden/novice form but caught the eye on penultimate start and has possibilities provided that promise is confirmed.

runners.name: Pink Petunia
runners.comment: Peak effort when second at this course on penultimate outing
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden; peak effort when second (behind a subsequent scorer) in 8.5f novice event at this course on penultimate outing; that form puts her in the picture.

runners.name: Pine Cliffs
runners.comment: Took well to cheekpieces at Chelmsford in November; may build on that win
runners.spotlight: Absent since taking well to first-time cheekpieces at Chelmsford (1m2f) in November; may build on that win and progress further in the retained headgear; ties in with Telecommunication on penultimate effort; shortlisted.

runners.name: Telecommunication
runners.comment: Form of final 2yo effort has worked out well; stable is in great form; very interesting
runners.spotlight: Absent since his promising third at Southwell (1m) in October when making AW/handicap debut, shaping as if this longer trip will suit; subsequently gelded; that race has worked out well and his stable is currently in great form; highly interesting off same mark.

runners.name: West Wickham
runners.comment: Brings a few possible sources of improvement
runners.spotlight: Far from solid on his autumn efforts but this switch to handicap level, new trip and first-time headgear are possible sources of improvement.

runners.name: Antelope
runners.comment: Good chance on standout effort but he's not a reliable proposition
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who produced his standout effort at this course in October, finishing second; good chance if back to that form but he's not a reliable proposition.

runners.name: Commander Flavius
runners.comment: Gelded over the winter and may do better this term
runners.spotlight: Not solid on 2yo form, albeit was possibly unsuited by heavy ground the last twice; gelded over the winter and may do better this term.

runners.name: Flaine
runners.comment: Took handicap record to 3-11 with Lingfield win last time; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Easily the most experienced contender; somewhat vulnerable to unexposed types but took her handicap record to 3-11 with Lingfield win (1m2f) last time and could well remain competitive.

runners.name: Romantic Spirit
runners.breeder: S A R L Haras De La Mercerie, F & P Ga
runners.comment: Perhaps best to forgive final 2yo effort; may still do better
runners.spotlight: One of a few runners who perhaps failed to handle heavy ground when last seen (handicap debut); has shown signs of ability otherwise and may still do better.

8:30.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.name: Boleyn Forever
runners.comment: Poor form from 7f-2m; impossible to recommend
runners.spotlight: Poor form from 7f-2m; impossible to recommend.

runners.name: Brave Display
runners.comment: Conditions to suit but this veteran hasn't been firing on all cylinders in 2025
runners.spotlight: His stable are enjoying a good year but this veteran hasn't been firing on all cylinders; minor money perhaps his best hope.

quotes.race: Metcollect Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Brave Display enjoyed the ground and we tried the blinkers today. He has ability, some days he turns up, some days he doesn't. We'll keep taking small steps with him - James Lambe, trainer.

quotes.race: Equine Products UK Handicap
quotes.quote: James said Brave Display was working well. He's rated 41 and he's back moving good and sweet. The man who owns him, Richard Behan, has bits and pieces in training every year. It's lovely to ride a winner for him - Seamie Heffernan, jockey.

quotes.race: Plusvital Powered By Equinome Handicap
quotes.quote: He's been up at Dundalk and I knew he needed a break from there. I thought he was as high as he wants to be [in the weights] and the 10lb claim was the key - Patrick Prendergast, trainer

quotes.race: Dundalk Business Club 2018 Handicap
quotes.quote: Chris gave him a very positive ride. They went hard and his best trip is probably 6f, so he stayed well to the line - Patrick Prendergast, trainer

runners.name: Brinton
runners.comment: 1m win last month and placed here on next two starts; not so good upped to 1m2f last week
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a similar event at Southwell last month (cheekpieces first time) and placed here on her next two starts; 1m2f looked to stretch her at Lingfield last week; more appealing than many.

runners.name: Cammy
runners.comment: 16-race maiden; only had three runs for this yard but he does need to pull out more
runners.spotlight: 0-16; three runs for his new yard have been respectable without suggesting he was ready to shed the maiden tag.

runners.name: Comedian Leader

prev_owners.owner: Aj Racing G Kelleway N Sowerby D Beedle

runners.comment: Three solid efforts since a wind op and this C&D holds no terrors; each-way shout at least
runners.spotlight: Had a wind op last month and she has returned with three creditable runs, third over C&D before chasing home an easy winner at Lingfield last week (7f); should remain competitive at this level.

runners.name: Glen Esk
runners.comment: Beat one rival in five runs for this yard in the autumn; blinkered for the first time
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over 1m2f on turf for Chris Wall, but was sidelined for nearly two years and has beaten one home in five runs for this stable; 130-day break, drop to classified company and the addition of blinkers aren't enough to tempt.

quotes.race: Giants Hall Handicap
quotes.quote: Glen Esk is a big unit and he's strengthened up a bit from last year. As he's a big horse I thought he might need the race and hopefully we can build on that through the year. There might be a nice little race to win with him further down the line - winning trainer Chris Wall.

stable_tour.quote: He was slow to come to hand this spring but we finally got him out at Yarmouth early this month when he ran a cracker to finish a neck second over a mile. We took him to Windsor on Sunday over 1m2f as he's a more mature horse this year and I thought he was properly ready for the trip, and he won well by three and a quarter lengths off a mark of 63. 30-06-21

runners.name: Kapparis Kid
runners.comment: Two 6f wins this year for T Carroll; needs to step up on form for this yard; stamina ?
runners.spotlight: Two 6f wins at Southwell this year when trained by Tony Carroll; three runs for current yard need bettering; stamina has to be taken on trust.

runners.name: Meng Tian
runners.comment: C&D winner one year ago; makes seasonal return in his first 0-50; serious contender
runners.spotlight: C&D winner one year ago; ended 2024 with a couple of fair efforts at Chelmsford; has an absence to contend with but this is his first foray into 0-50 company and he's a serious player.

quotes.race: Coral Proud To Support British Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Meng Tian has improved a lot physically from two to three and Mr Woods was quite happy with him. The vibes were positive and he did well as he had a tricky old trip to come from the back. The leaders ran off the bend, which took us quite wide, so he's done well, but I was always confident and I don't see why he can't build on this - James Doyle, rider.

runners.name: Sir Laurence Graff

prev_owners.owner: White Birch Farm, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor

runners.comment: Banging at the door this year; drops back in trip with cheekpieces now tried; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Beaten under one length in three of his last four starts and although this is a drop in trip, he looks more likely to give his running than most; cheekpieces added for the first time.

runners.name: Star Of Atlantis
runners.comment: 7f win for Jack Jones in January; three fair runs for new stable but has to prove stamina
runners.spotlight: Won a similar race at Southwell in January when trained by Jack Jones; three respectable efforts for current stable but she hasn't convinced stamina-wise in earlier runs at 1m+.

runners.name: You Are Everything
runners.comment: 19-race maiden but capable at this level; tongue-tie added and Hector Crouch booked
runners.spotlight: Unlucky not to break her duck over 7f here last month; not so good twice since (met trouble over C&D latest) but the new tongue-tie and the booking of Hector Crouch offer hope of better.

4:15.race_name: Wincanton Fireworks On Sale Now Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Mares' Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Komedy Kicks
runners.comment: Form figures of 411P for new yard; let down by jumping when upped to 3m last time
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 411P since joining Dan Skelton, the wins over 2m2f/2m3f; let down by jumping when upped to 3m last time and may show that she stays this trip provided errors are avoided; not written off.

quotes.race: racingtv.com/sale Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Lady Buttons Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Komedy Kicks has had her issues but is clearly getting back to old form. Maybe she can still improve - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At Vickers.Bet Maiden Hurdle (Arc Summer Novices' Brush Hurdle) (GBB) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Komedy Kicks was just going left the whole way and then going to the second-last I don't know what she did, she just went right-handed which caught me unaware. To be fair, the more pressure I put her under the more she gave me. She seems to be going the right way - Harry Cobden, jockey.

runners.name: Briefly
runners.comment: Disappointing here last Monday; consistent otherwise and bounced back at Ascot yesterday
runners.spotlight: Disappointing here last Monday but has proved consistent otherwise and bounced back with a respectable effort at Ascot yesterday; solid second (behind subsequent scorer) over C&D in February; remains of interest.

runners.name: La Dolce Dolly
runners.comment: Plumpton win took her record at this sort of distance to 2-2; open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who is 2-2 at this sort of distance, the wins in Irish point (3m) last May and Plumpton handicap hurdle (3m1f) this month, both on good ground; open to further improvement and commands respect.

runners.name: Pure Theatre
runners.comment: Record suggests she's a spring mare; this looks the time to catch her; handy mark
runners.spotlight: Not particularly solid on this season's form but record suggests she's a spring mare and this looks the time to catch her; attractively handicapped, being 8lb below the mark of her sole handicap success.

runners.name: Calli Black
runners.comment: Physical tweak (wind surgery since last run) may prompt improvement
runners.spotlight: Point winner who has bits of encouraging rules form; folded tamely in latest outing (handicap debut) but subsequent wind surgery may enable her to last longer; improvement possible.

2:45.race_name: We Put The Win In Wincanton Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Minniemum
runners.owner: Strachan, Corbett, Salwey, Inkin, Griffith, Graham
runners.comment: Scored by wide margin at Exeter (chase debut) eight days ago; leading player
runners.spotlight: Made all for wide-margin success in similar event at Exeter (3m, good to firm) eight days ago, taking well to fences at the first attempt; looks capable of defying a 7lb penalty.

quotes.race: Racingtv.com Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Lady Buttons Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It's just unfortunate, one of those things, and I feel sorry for the owners and the stable staff at home. I thought today Minniemum would lose her maiden tag and everything had gone right, she'd got into a nice rhythm. It's a shame. We'll try again - Richard Patrick, rider.

runners.name: So Said I
runners.owner: And So Say All Of Us Partnership
runners.comment: Modest strike-rate over fences but best form gives her a fighting chance
runners.spotlight: Below-par third in similar event at Taunton last time and still has a modest strike-rate (1-12) over fences; however, best form gives her a fighting chance off current mark.

stable_tour.quote: She's coming back from an injury and will be ready to run at the end of the month, when we'll go for mares' novicees. The plan at this stage is to follow a similar programme we took with Rose Of Arcadia at the backend of last season. 10-11-23

runners.name: Lady Jago
runners.comment: Has regressive chase form but holds a good chance if back on song
runners.spotlight: Point/hurdle winner who has regressive form since switched to chasing (three attempts); however, holds a good chance off current mark provided there's a turnaround.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden very well and has been second since to two nice horses. She'll go into handicaps, where she'll continue to pay her way, and she'll jump a fence in time. 12-11-24

runners.name: Melusine De Pail
runners.breeder: Jean Raymond Brenton, Fanny Brenton & Ca
runners.comment: Not helped by early mistakes last time; possibilities if avoiding errors
runners.spotlight: Point winner who is 0-10 under rules but has largely consistent form; wasn't helped by early mistakes last time; possibilities off current mark provided she avoids errors.

2:15.race_name: Golf Membership On Sale Now Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Off To A Flyer
runners.owner: Mrs Mary-Ann Middleton And J P Romans
runners.comment: Absent since justifying market support at Huntingdon ten months ago; check the betting
runners.spotlight: Absent since justifying market support at Huntingdon (3m1f, good) ten months ago when returned to hurdles after an unsuccessful spell over fences; the betting may again prove instructive.

quotes.race: Thistle Cabs Group Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Off To A Flyer got stuck in the mud at Sandown and the better ground and longer trip helped him here. I can't wait to jump a fence with him next autumn - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We got balloted out on the Pertemps qualifier at Cheltenham the other week which was frustrating. We'd like to give him one more run over hurdles before we go novice chasing so we could look at Cheltenham again. We could look at a Pertemps race just to get another option. He loves a bit of good ground and his form from last season was pretty good. 10-11-23

He was going to go to Wincanton tomorrow for a novice handicap chase but it's been abandoned. I thought he ran all right at Kempton when we last saw him. He was flat out all the way, but he jumped with credit on his first run over fences and is a spring horse. He comes right then, so I'm not writing him off. 18-01-24

runners.name: Jackpot Dathou
runners.comment: Has become disappointing but a revival would give him good claims off current mark
runners.spotlight: Two wins as a novice hurdler last term; disappointing since, most recently switched to fences; however, has possibilities off a reduced mark provided he stages a revival back in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: Despite winning twice from four starts, his form over hurdles lacked consistency last season; he's a good workhorse at home but we haven't yet seen him reproduce it on the track. We fancied him strongly when he finished last in a handicap up at Ayr on his final start, and to this day I haven't the faintest idea why he ran so badly. His wind wasn't great, so we've had that tweaked over the summer. His mark of 121 is one I think we can win off. 04-11-24

runners.name: Jack Sprat
runners.comment: Assuming he rebounds, looks interesting with Will Biddick booked
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-13 over hurdles, the most recent win at Exeter (2m7f)  in January; well held in both subsequent starts but, assuming he rebounds, looks interesting with Will Biddick booked.

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The step up in trip has suited Jack Sprat who is still a bit of a baby. I had a target two out when I chased the leader and hit the front at the right time as he may have pricked his ears if he was in front too long. The ground on the stands rail was less churned up and he enjoyed it - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: The penny is dropping and he should keep improving. I was buzzing when he won at Huntingdon recently, but it was about time! We'll work our way up the handicap and then go chasing next autumn. 15-11-23
Yet to win, but he made the frame in a bumper and has been placed over hurdles. He has been backward but is improving and, consequently, could be well handicapped to get off the mark. 28-09-23

runners.name: Iron Heart
runners.comment: Could be set for another successful spring/summer campaign; on a handy mark
runners.spotlight: Scored on good ground last May/July and could be set for another successful spring/summer campaign with recent Chepstow effort (when back from a layoff) under his belt; possibilities off a handy mark.

quotes.race: Kevin Hall & Pat Boakes Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Iron Heart has worked smartly and ran good at Newmarket last time behind a progressive sort. Hopefully he'll go on to better things - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Jack The Savage
runners.owner: M White J Frampton L Horsfall

prev_owners.owner: M White C Voysey J Frampton L Horsfall

runners.comment: Only 1-15 over hurdles but holds a fighting chance off current mark
runners.spotlight: Only 1-15 over hurdles, the success in October 2023; however, has some encouraging form this term, respectable second at Huntingdon (2m3f) most recently; fighting chance off current mark.

quotes.race: Discover Whats Trending At Rhino.Bet Casino Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I love this horse, but he has had such bad luck. He ran his race before it started at Worcester as he bucked the jockey off twice then he was due to go to Fakenham, but that was abandoned then at Hereford he was withdrawn after he kicked Alex Edwards (jockey). Although he is called Jack The Savage he is anything but that as he is my hack at home every day and he is such a legend.

runners.name: Mairis Icon
runners.comment: May raise her game off a reduced mark; bred to stay this distance
runners.spotlight: Registered sole success in 1m7f novice hurdle at Wincanton last season; has a touch of sixthitis this term but may be able to raise her game off a reduced mark; bred to stay this distance.

4:45.race_name: Perfect Family Day Out Handicap Chase

runners.name: Another Folly
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie D'Ossau Et Al
runners.comment: Still a maiden but posted a solid effort over C&D on penultimate start; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but has some encouraging form since switched to chasing, notably a solid effort (second to subsequent winner) over C&D on penultimate start; possibilities back here.

runners.name: Shillanavogy
runners.comment: Novice chaser who has lacked consistency but is again capable of being involved
runners.spotlight: Novice chaser who won at Fontwell (2m5f) in December and ran creditably at Southwell (3m) most recently; has lacked consistency but is again capable of being involved.

quotes.race: Hereford Countryside Raceday This Sunday Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shillanavogy always shown plenty but he's just been a bit of a slow burner - Warren Greatrex, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has plenty of ability and I always thought he wanted soft ground, but he doesn't handle it. He was third over 3m½f at Southwell on Monday. He'll go on into the spring, he gets 3m and he jumps much better on better ground. There's a bit of scope for improvement but he's been a work in progress. 05-03-25

runners.name: Dunstall Rambler
runners.comment: In great form at about 2m of late; likely player provided he stays this new trip
runners.spotlight: All of his chase form is at about 2m; good second at Wincanton most recently, when bidding for a hat-trick of wins in novice handicaps; likely player provided he stays this new trip.

runners.name: Abingworth
runners.comment: Defied a 9lb higher mark in this corresponding event last year; interesting back here
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent this term but ran one of his better races last time; defied a 9lb higher mark in this corresponding event (when it was a Class 4) last year and is interesting back here.

runners.name: Birdman Bob
runners.comment: Has shown best form at Plumpton; something to prove at this contrasting venue
runners.spotlight: On a workable mark but has shown best form at Plumpton, notably sole hurdles win and a second-place finish over fences last time; something to prove at this contrasting course.

quotes.race: Cranbrook Underwriting Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Birdman Bob seems to like the track and the softer ground has definitely helped him. I was a bit worried about him not having a run for seven-odd months but he's run all the way to the line and he's probably matured from having that break - Philip Armson, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He wants a bit of dig in the ground but he's got a fantastic pedigree, being by Flemensfirth and out of a half-sister to Monalee. 02-11-21

runners.name: My Rockstar
runners.comment: May be more interesting when back down the weights; both wins off 7lb lower
runners.spotlight: Remains in form but has his limitations and may be more interesting when back down the weights, having gained both wins off 7lb lower; others seem better treated.

runners.name: Gladiatus
runners.comment: Lightly raced 9yo who needs improvement to get off the mark
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 9yo; only a modest fourth at Huntingdon (second chase attempt) most recently and needs improvement to get off the mark.

3:15.race_name: Cheese & Cider Night 16th April Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Jackstell
runners.comment: Second to main market rival at Ascot yesterday; one of the main form contenders
runners.spotlight: Irish bumper winner who has form figures of 232 in maiden hurdles (2m/2m3f) for new yard, most recently beaten by main market rival at Ascot yesterday on return from break; one of the main players on the figures.

runners.name: Rascallion
runners.comment: Interesting on Ludlow effort (second behind a useful sort); debut for new stable
runners.spotlight: Three Flat wins in France; both hurdles starts for Keiran Burke, finishing second at Ludlow (behind useful sort who has progressed since) then beaten when falling at Kempton where he wore a hood (now removed); interesting on the penultimate effort.

runners.name: Sure To Be Sure
runners.comment: Hurdles debutant who has very weak claims on bumper form
runners.spotlight: Hurdles debutant who has very weak claims on his bumper form.

runners.name: Ted The Thief
runners.comment: Point winner; beaten long way at Taunton on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Took six attempts to get off the mark in points; beaten long way at Taunton on the switch to rules; opposed.

runners.name: Elforleather

prev_owners.owner: G & J Styles, S Fruci & Partner

runners.comment: Juvenile hurdler who has something to find on the figures
runners.spotlight: Juvenile hurdler who failed to build on his Southwell effort when comfortably held at Kelso; just ordinary on the Flat and lacks potential; may find better opportunities in handicaps soon.

quotes.race: Prostate Cymru New Stags Head Carmarthen Handicap
quotes.quote: To be fair to Elforleather he's been consistent and deserved that. He relishes the ground and stays the trip well - Edward Greatrex, jockey.

runners.name: Roadshow

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Michael Tabor & Mrs John Magnier
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
Derrick Smith & Michael Tabor & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: French Flat form featured a debut win and creditable effort at Listed level; respected
runners.spotlight: French import whose Flat form for Andre Fabre featured a debut win and creditable effort at Listed level; sold for 67,000euros and had gelding/wind operations since last run; respected on debut for Paul Nicholls.

stable_tour.quote: Another of the French imports, who was bought at the Arqana Sale in July. He won his only Flat start at two for Andre Fabre, but rather lost his way this year. We've gelded him and he's recently back from a wind op, so won't be out in juvenile hurdles until after Christmas. 04-11-24

3:45.race_name: You Can't Catch Me Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Ellerton
runners.breeder: S C E A Le Haras D'Haspel

prev_owners.owner: Light, Kenyon, Romans, Van Der Horst
K Kenyon, J Romans, W Van Der Horst

runners.comment: Has some encouraging hurdles form and may improve for this new trip; debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Sold out of Anthony Charlton's yard for £44,000 since last run; Flat winner who is 0-10 over hurdles but has some encouraging form, including at Wincanton, and may improve for this new trip; possibilities.

runners.name: Jimmyjeroo
runners.comment: Not particularly solid on overall form but the good ground may help returned to hurdles
runners.spotlight: Ran poorly over fences last time; not particularly solid on overall form but record suggests he may show improvement in this first attempt in a good-ground handicap hurdle.

runners.name: Jack Hoola
runners.comment: Fitting of tongue-tie and cheekpieces looks a possible source of improvement
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Irish point; has largely unconvincing rules form but the fitting of tongue-tie and cheekpieces looks a possible source of improvement in this third handicap attempt.

runners.name: Jaxonne
runners.breeder: Earl Trinquet, O Trinquet & M Trinquet
runners.comment: Seems a spring type and could go well off a workable mark on return from 66-day break
runners.spotlight: Opened his account with an easy success at Ludlow (2m5f, good) last May; mixed results since but is seemingly a spring type and could go well off a workable mark on return from 66-day break.

quotes.race: Sinclair Discovery Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Jaxonne improved for the better ground and we're glad to have finally hit the nail on the head with him. We'll have a look and see if we can go again [under a penalty], he usually comes out of his races well - AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Roxhill
runners.comment: Signs of improvement since handicapping and this return to 2m4f is well worth exploring
runners.spotlight: Signs of improvement in a couple of 2m events since handicapping and this return to 2m4f is well worth exploring judged on pedigree; interesting contender, with a bigger effort plausible.

runners.name: Seahouses
runners.comment: Improved form last month, making all at Market Rasen then second at Hereford; respected
runners.spotlight: Improved form last month, making all at Market Rasen (2m4f) then good second at Hereford (2m5f); ridden by Isabelle Ryder both times; may have more to offer at this level and warrants respect.

runners.name: Lakes Aventurine
runners.comment: Couple of non-completions since switched to handicap level; opposed
runners.spotlight: Has totally failed to back up debut effort; couple of non-completions since switched to handicap level; enough to prove.

runners.name: As Good As Can Be
runners.comment: Poor claims on form; tongue-tie needs to make a big difference
runners.spotlight: Has poor claims on form; application of tongue-tie needs to make a big difference.

5:15.race_name: Family Raceday Sunday 13th April Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Maldini Milano
runners.comment: Scored easily at Exeter; best to forgive subsequent effort; remains open to progress
runners.spotlight: Easily justified favouritism in weak race at Exeter (good) then shaped as if something was amiss and/or didn't handle soft ground in Listed event at Newbury; represents top yard and remains open to progress.

runners.name: Ask A Sainte
runners.comment: Half-brother to his yard's 2m chase winner Thatza Dazzler who was unplaced in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Newcomer who may be more interesting later on, being a half-brother to his stable's 2m chase winner Thatza Dazzler who was unplaced in two bumpers; yard is only 1-61 in this type of race.

runners.name: Impact Player
runners.owner: Galloping On The South Downs Partnership
runners.comment: First foal of a bumper-winning sister to Champion Bumper winner Ballyandy; interesting
runners.spotlight: First foal of a bumper-winning sister to winners Ballyandy (Champion Bumper and smart hurdle/chase), Megastar (Flat and useful bumper/2m hurdle) and Megasue (bumper/hurdle); wears tongue-tie on debut; very attractively bred and looks interesting.

runners.name: Nathans Run
runners.comment: Wasn't helped by meeting trouble last time and may yet confirm his Uttoxeter promise
runners.spotlight: Wasn't helped by being involved in some scrimmaging at Huntingdon (had wind surgery since) and may yet confirm the promise of his second-place finish at Uttoxeter (good); tongue-tie applied.

runners.name: Vol Royale
runners.comment: Point winner; ran with promise at Kempton and that form has been nicely boosted since
runners.spotlight: Good-ground point winner who is out of a bumper scorer; ran with promise at Kempton (soft) where he finished two places behind a smart prospect who subsequently landed a valuable pot at Newbury; possibilities.

runners.name: She Rocks The Park
runners.comment: Last of five finishers in Irish point but that race has thrown up two rules winners
runners.spotlight: Last of five finishers in Irish point 11 months ago but that race has thrown up a couple of rules winners; check the market signals for further guidance.

runners.name: Takeonedayatatime
runners.comment: Promising third in C&D event five months ago; respected with progress plausible
runners.spotlight: Out of a bumper/Flat winner; absent since her promising third in newcomers' event over C&D (good) five months ago; presumably saved for spring ground and warrants respect with progress plausible.

runners.name: Keep Off The Sugar
runners.comment: Predominantly Flat trainer is 0-8 in bumpers; check the betting for further guidance
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 6f AW winner (RPR 88) but could get stamina from his sire; predominantly Flat trainer is 0-8 in bumpers; check the betting for further assistance.

runners.name: Royal Mark
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant & J Le Roux
runners.comment: Flat-bred 4yo; booking of Sean Bowen (good strike-rate for this yard) bodes well
runners.spotlight: Brother to German/French 7f-8.5f winner Royal Fox (RPR 97), closely related to Swiss 6f 2yo winner Picador, out of a 1m winner; booking of Sean Bowen (good strike-rate for this yard) bodes well.
